Description: Neck fragment with handle root from Ionian pottery table amphora; inside, upper part slipped red-black, with red band lined inadded white; outside, beige slip, cable pattern painted in glaze fired red-brown;.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by Antikenmuseum, Heidelberg. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Schlotzhauer 2012, p. 129 no. Nau 93, classifies the amphora as a late example of the Milesian Wild Goat style or possibly early Fikellura.
Bibliographic references: Schlotzhauer 2012 / Untersuchungen zur archaischen griechischen Keramik aus Naukratis (p. 128-9, no. Nau 93, pl. 21, fig. d)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GE.958)
